thread.title: Watch: Photo finish after wild run to the line
thread.title_full: Watch: Photo finish after wild run to the line

title: Watch: Photo finish after wild run to the line
text:
WorldSSP: Photo finish required after barging match at Phillip Island February 26, 2017 3:53pm @willdale956 Source: FOX SPORTS OFFICIALS had to resort to the photo finish camera after Roberto Rolfo and Lucas Mahias bumped and barged their way to the chequered flag in the World Supersport race at Phillip Island. 
The pair forced each other left and right across Gardner Straight, Rolfo running onto the grass after the finish line after the last of Mahias’ moves. 
The timing system gave Rolfo the win provisionally, but officials reviewed the finish to ensure the right rider was declared the winner. The photo finish image. Source: FOX SPORTS 
The photo gave Rolfo the nod, the margin calculated to be just 0.001 of a second. 
It punctuated an already dramatic final lap, which saw Jules Cluzel spectacularly crash out of podium contention at the penultimate corner, taking Mahias’ teammate Federico Carcasulo with him. 
All the drama allowed Australian rider Anthony West through to take a remarkable podium finish in third after a dramatic week. 
Engine problems plagued his effort throughout practice and qualifying, a generous fan allowing West to take the motor out of the Yamaha road bike he had trackside and use it in his race bike! 
All three Australians finished inside the top 10, Adrian Wagner taking seventh place and young Lachlan Epis claiming his first top 10 finish. Lucky escapes in horror crash 0:15 
An early red flag for a horrific crash, where Gino Rea hit Robin Mulhauser’s crashing bike, forced the race to be shortened to 10 laps. Both riders were uninjured but were unable to take grid for the restart.
